Constructor Detail

Zoom

protected Zoom()
Method Detail

on

public final Zoom on(Zoom.ZoomEventType type,
                     DatumFunction<Void> listener)
Registers the specified listener to receive events of the specified type from the zoom behavior.

See Zoom.ZoomEventType for more information.

If an event listener was already registered for the same type, the existing listener is removed before the new listener is added. TODO: To register multiple listeners for the same event type, the type may be followed by an optional namespace, such as "zoom.foo" and "zoom.bar". To remove a listener, pass null as the listener.

For mousewheel events, which happen discretely with no explicit start and end reported by the browser, events that occur within 50 milliseconds of each other are grouped into a single zoom gesture. If you want more robust interpretation of these gestures, please petition your browser vendor of choice for better touch event support.

Parameters:
type -
listener -
Returns:
the current zoom instance

x

public final QuantitativeScale<?> x()
Return the current x-scale that is automatically adjusted when zooming, or null if no scale have been specified.

Returns:
the x-scale

x

public final Zoom x(QuantitativeScale<?> scale)
Specifies an x-scale whose domain should be automatically adjusted when zooming.

If the scale's domain or range is modified programmatically, this function should be called again.

Parameters:
scale - the scale
Returns:
Zoom the current Zoom object

y

public final QuantitativeScale<?> y()
Return the current y-scale that is automatically adjusted when zooming, or null if no scale have been specified.

Returns:
the y-scale

y

public final Zoom y(QuantitativeScale<?> scale)
Specifies an y-scale whose domain should be automatically adjusted when zooming.

If not specified, returns the current y-scale, which defaults to null. If the scale's domain or range is modified programmatically, this function should be called again

Parameters:
the - scale
Returns:
the current zoom object

public final Array<Double> scaleExtent()
Return the zoom scale's allowed range as a two-element array, [*minimum*, maximum].

Returns:
the zoom scale's allowed range as a two-element array

scaleExtent

public final Zoom scaleExtent(Array<Double> scale)
Specifies the zoom scale's allowed range as a two-element array, [*minimum*, maximum]. If not specified, returns the current scale extent, which defaults to [0, Infinity].

Parameters:
the - zoom scale's allowed range as a two-element array
Returns:
the current zoom object

center

public final Zoom center(double x,
                         double y)
If center is specified, sets the focal point [x, y] for mousewheel zooming and returns this zoom behavior.

A null center indicates that mousewheel zooming should zoom in and out around the current mouse location.

Returns:
the

center

public final Array<Double> center()
Returns the current focal point, which defaults to null.

A null center indicates that mousewheel zooming should zoom in and out around the current mouse location.

Returns:
the array of double

size

public final Zoom size(int width,
                       int height)
If size is specified, sets the viewport size to the specified dimensions [width, height] and returns this zoom behavior.

A size is needed to support smooth zooming during transitions.

Parameters:
width - the width of the viewport
height - the height of the viewport
Returns:
the current zoom instance

size

public final Array<Double> size()
Returns the current viewport size which defaults to [960, 500].

Returns:
the size

event

public final Zoom event(Selection selection)
Immediately dispatches a zoom gesture to registered listeners, as the three event sequence Zoom.ZoomEventType.ZOOMSTART, Zoom.ZoomEventType.ZOOM and Zoom.ZoomEventType.ZOOMEND.

This can be useful in triggering listeners after setting the translate(Array) or scale(double) programatically.

Parameters:
selection - the selection to triggers the events to.
Returns:
the current zoom

event

public final Zoom event(Transition selection)
Registers the appropriate tweens so that the zoom behavior dispatches events over the course of the transition: a Zoom.ZoomEventType.ZOOMSTART event when the transition starts from the previously-set view, Zoom.ZoomEventType.ZOOM events for each tick of the transition, and finally a Zoom.ZoomEventType.ZOOMEND event when the transition ends.

Note that the transition will be interrupted if the user starts zooming before the transition ends.

Parameters:
selection -
Returns:
